subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|肀|女|ls=ic|t1=hand|t2=woman}} ― a man grabbing a woman's hair to show ownership ({{w|marriage by capture}}).

subSections.title: Definitions
Readings
Etymology 1
Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|つま}} # {{lb|ja|sort=つま|archaic}} a [[spouse]] # {{lb|ja|sort=つま|humble|only refers to one's own}} a [[wife]] {{gl|married woman}} #* {{quote-book |genre=fiction |||lang=ja |location=Tokyo |publisher=Kodansha |first=Osamu |last=Tezuka |authorlink=Osamu Tezuka |{{w2|ja|ブラック・ジャック}} |trans-title={{w|Black Jack (manga)|Black Jack}} |date=Feb 15 1999 |origdate=Jun 20 1983 |isbn=4-06-108768-1 |volume=18 ||176 |edition=8th |chapter={{lang|ja|第８話　未知への挑戦}} |trans-chapter=Chapter 8: Challenge of the Third Kind |{{ruby|{{lang|ja|先生………………私の'''妻'''は美しいでしょう？
ああ！すばらしい美人ですよ！
でしょう？なにしろ昨年のミス・イウレガだったのですから}}}} |transliteration=''Sensei……………… Watashi no '''tsuma''' wa utsukushii deshō?
Ā! Subarashii bijin desu yo!
Deshō? Nani shiro sakunen no Misu Iurega datta no desu kara'' |translation=Doctor……………… Do you think my wife is beautiful?
Sure! She’s a gorgeous lady!
I know, right? She was last year’s Miss Iurega after all}}

subSections.title: Synonyms
Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|つま}}
By extension from the ''at the'' {{m|en|side}} sense.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

subSections.title: Noun
Noun
Usage notes
subSections.text: * Used chiefly in written texts such as letters.
